name: Own Two Hands, Own Two Feet
name_original: Own Two Hands, Own Two Feet
description:
Own Two Hands, Own Two Feet is a game based around cartography and hunting for secrets on three distinct islands. 

Explore an island - take photos and notes. 

Map out that island - get a canvas and paint what you've seen. 

Find its secrets - use your map and decode the clues you're given to locate hidden geocaches. 

The game features:

- Three islands with differing themes; explore a tropical shipwreck site, an abandoned mountainous mine, and a dense forest rich with hidden signs of life. 

- A series of documentation tools; take photos at any time with a camera, jot down thoughts on a notepad, and find the right viewpoint with a pair of binoculars. 

- An in-depth painting system; review your photos and notes, then toggle between two brush types and adjust size/color to your liking. 

- 20+ riddles and secret collectables to hunt down; locate geocaches using a series of cryptic clues and piece together an overarching mystery across all three islands. 

Made by: 

Harrison Sinnamon/applemons (project manager/programmer/level designer)

France Reinhart/Frankie (artist/level designer)

Orlando Mason (audio)

This project was made over the course of ~7 months. 

Quick Reference: 

- WASD to move, mouse to look, scroll wheel to change tools

- E to interact when looking at an interactable object

- Left click with camera to take pictures

- Left click with notepad to enter typing mode; enter in typing mode to save note

- Right click with binoculars to zoom, left click while zoomed to adjust zoom

- H after mapping out an island to view geocache hints

- ESC to return to menu (progress is saved until you exit the game)
